vehicles.description: A white car is driving in the same direction on the right lane of its own vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle affects the ability of my own vehicle to change lanes or adjust speed in order to maintain a safe following distance.

vehicles.description: On the right-hand lane ahead, there appears to be a dark-colored car traveling in the same direction.
vehicles.explanation: The existence of cars determines the direction of traffic flow and requires monitoring to predict any potential sudden stops or turns.

vehicles.description: There are construction vehicles on the left side of the road, where a yellow excavator can be seen.
vehicles.explanation: Construction vehicles may move irregularly, potentially affecting traffic flow.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Workers can be seen in the construction area on the left side of the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of workers indicates that autonomous vehicles should slow down and proceed with caution to ensure the safety of the workers.

traffic signs.description: Signs with blue arrows indicate merging right or lane changing.
traffic signs.explanation: It is recommended that you prepare to make necessary adjustments to your position on the road when driving your own vehicle.

traffic signs.description: A triangular warning sign on the right indicates that merging or yielding is necessary ahead.
traffic signs.explanation: This sign alerts the driver to be aware of potential parallel traffic and to be prepared to yield or adjust speed accordingly.

traffic cones.description: Orange traffic cones are placed on the left side of this lane, directing traffic to merge right.
traffic cones.explanation: This indicates that there is a lane shift or construction area ahead. Drivers need to proceed with caution and may need to change lanes.

barriers.description: On the left side of the road, there is a green mesh fence surrounding a construction site.
barriers.explanation: These provide visual cues for road construction and potential changes in traffic conditions.

other objects.description: There is a puddle on the road.
other objects.explanation: Accumulated water may lead to skidding, therefore the car should maintain an appropriate speed and distance from other vehicles.

other objects.description: Debris or equipment visible in the construction area on the left.
other objects.explanation: This may enter the driving lane, so this vehicle should maintain a safe distance, always ready to respond to unexpected obstacles.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there are several elements that are noteworthy. Firstly, there is a white car driving in the same direction on the right lane, which requires my vehicle to consider lane changes or speed adjustments to keep a safe distance. Additionally, a dark-colored car is traveling ahead in the right-hand lane, necessitating monitoring for any sudden stops or turns that may affect the traffic flow.

On the left side of the road, construction vehicles, including a yellow excavator, are present. These vehicles may move unpredictably and could impact the flow of traffic. Workers are also visible in the construction area on the left, indicating that autonomous vehicles should reduce speed and exercise caution to protect their safety.

Regarding traffic signs, there are blue arrow signs indicating the need to merge right or change lanes, suggesting that drivers should be ready to adjust their road position. A triangular warning sign on the right signals the necessity to merge or yield soon, alerting the driver to be prepared for potential parallel traffic and to adjust speed or yield as needed.

Orange traffic cones are placed on the left side of the lane, directing traffic to merge right, signaling a lane shift or construction zone ahead, which requires drivers to be cautious and possibly change lanes.

A green mesh fence is located on the left side of the road, surrounding a construction site, serving as a visual cue for road construction and potential traffic condition changes.

Other objects include a puddle on the road, which could cause skidding, so it is important to maintain a proper speed and distance from other vehicles. There is also debris or equipment in the construction area on the left, which could enter the driving lane, necessitating a safe distance and readiness to react to unexpected obstacles.

driving_suggestion: Your vehicle should maintain a safe distance from the car ahead, always be ready to respond to potential movements of construction vehicles, and remain vigilant for pedestrians near crosswalks. You should also anticipate the need to merge right due to traffic cones and wet, slippery road surfaces. Given the nearby construction activities, lane mergers, and wet conditions, it is wise to slow down appropriately to ensure safety. Maintain a moderate speed, closely monitor the dynamics of the white sedan to respond to any lane changes, and be prepared to yield at the merge point indicated by traffic signs, increasing alertness in the construction zone. Keep a safe distance from the construction area, always be ready to stop or maneuver to avoid unexpected obstacles. Be mindful of wet road conditions, and adjust your braking distance and speed accordingly.

1.description and explanation: This is a bus, a large vehicle designed to carry multiple passengers, which is currently sharing the road with the ego vehicle. In the future driving behavior, the ego vehicle should maintain a safe following distance from the bus, be cautious of passengers that may be entering or exiting the bus, and be prepared for the bus to make stops at designated areas.

2.description and explanation: This is a construction vehicle, often used in roadwork or nearby construction sites. Visibility around such a vehicle might be limited due to its size and the nature of its operation. The ego vehicle should approach with caution, maintain a safe distance, and be aware that the construction vehicle could make sudden movements or stops. There might also be construction workers or other equipment in the vicinity that require attention.

3.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, typically used to mark areas of the road that are under construction or to indicate a change in the traffic pattern. The presence of a traffic cone requires the driver to be alert to potential hazards, lane closures, or diversions ahead. It may also indicate the presence of workers on the road, which necessitates reduced speed and increased attention while driving past the area.

4.description and explanation: This is a traffic cone, typically used to signal areas under construction or where part of the road is not safe for vehicles. It is often bright orange with reflective stripes for visibility. The presence of this cone on the road will likely require the ego car to adjust its path, avoiding the cone and any potential hazards associated with the area it is marking.
